message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.NI. 

The paper discusses a fault-tolerant and highly available distributed storage solution, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The use of erasure coding for achieving data redundancy suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of coding theory (cs.SY). The paper also discusses self-stabilization, which is a technique used to recover from transient faults, suggesting that it may fall under the category of fault tolerance (cs.CR). Finally, the implementation and evaluation of the algorithm on a distributed infrastructure suggest that it may also fall under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI).
